New Records: Glenn Phillips scored a stunning century off 61 balls before falling for 104
Trent Boult achieved career-best T20 international figures of 4-13
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka collapsed to 8-4 early before being bowled out for 102
New Zealand recovered from 15-3 to post 167-7
Glenn Phillips was dropped on 12 and 45 before scoring a century
Trent Boult took 4 wickets for 13 runs
Lahiru Kumara was stumped by Devon Conway off Ish Sodhi
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson emphasized the importance of focusing on the next game and making adjustments
Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka acknowledged areas for improvement, especially in fielding
Kane Williamson praised Glenn Phillips' remarkable performance under pressure
Glenn Phillips expressed his happiness with his process and the team's all-round performance
Stuart Clark remarked on the comprehensive nature of New Zealand's win and the impact of Glenn Phillips' innings
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand are now Group 1 leaders with five points, two clear of England, Ireland, and Australia
New Zealand are almost assured of a semi-final spot with a win over England likely to seal it
